name: Argument Theory

prereqs.text: ((76-373 [] at least D) and (76-101 [] at least D)) or ((76-102 [] at least D) and (76-373 [] at least D)) or ((76-107 [] at least D) and (76-106 [] at least D) and (76-373 [] at least D)) or ((76-107 [] at least D) and (76-108 [] at least D) and (76-373 [] at least D)) or ((76-106 [] at least D) and (76-108 [] at least D) and (76-373 [] at least D))

long_desc: Please note Freshmen are prohibited from registering for this course. Sophomores must obtain instructor permission.

custom_fields.goals: The objectives of the seminar is for you 1 to acquire the concepts needed to read the current researchscholarship on argumentation with understanding, 2 to apply that research to the analysis of arguments, and 3 to contribute to that research.
custom_fields.prerequisite_knowledge: Undergraduate students: (1) 76-373/773, Topics in Rhetoric: Argument or (2) permission of the instructor.
custom_fields.assessment_structure: Reading assignments, participation in discussion, discussion questions and discussion posts, and seminar paper.
custom_fields.relevance: Argumentation is central to rhetoric as conceived as a discipline concerned with finding all the available means of persuasion.
custom_fields.extra_time_commitment: Time to do the reading, think about them, formulate good questions, and to do research for the seminar paper and write a seminar paper.
